24/7 hotlines

  1. Call 211 for free counseling, treatment programs, free info on mental health, legal services, & more.
  2. Text MDMINDHEALTH to 898211 for mental health or substance use disorder (SUD) needs.
  3. Call 866 210 1303 for the National Rehab Hotline, where accredited specialists will help you through an SUD or mental health crisis.

Needle exchange

The Baltimore City Health Department’s Needle Exchange Program operates many locations throughout the week. The closest location is Maryland & 21st, Druid Hill Clinic (Side Lot), open Tuesdays 10:30am–11:30pm.

Learn about more locations and their hours at health.baltimorecity.gov/hiv-std-services/community-risk-reduction .

Fentanyl test strips & naloxone (Narcan)

Naloxone (Narcan) can be purchased with no prescription at any pharmacy that carries it. The nearest pharmacy that carries naloxone is CVS at 3200 St. Paul St. .

Many Overdose Response Program (ORP) locations offer fentanyl test strips. The nearest location that offers them is Project Connections @ Behavioral Health Leadership Institute, Inc. at 2601 N Howard Street (4436833498) .

Some ORP locations offer free naloxone by mail. The nearest location that offers this is Baltimore Harm Reduction Coalition at 116 E. 25th St. (4102055143) .

See more info and access an ORP finder at health.maryland.gov/pha/NALOXONE/Pages/Approved-Entities.aspx
